Semester Schedule

The schedule will be flexible as we cover each topic. We might spend some extra time on topics, so we will update the schedule as we progress through the semester.

Mtg Date Topic Notes
1 8/22/2023 Introduction. World Wide What? A history.
2 8/24/2023 A brief history, Networks, and HTTP
Readings: - Slides:
3 8/29/2023 What is the web software model?
4 8/31/2023 What is important to consider when designing a website?
5 9/5/2023 Design, Introduction to HTML, How did we get here?
6 9/7/2023 History of HTML, HTML features, Designing HTML
7 9/12/2023 Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Responsive design
8 9/14/2023 Extending CSS Scripting with LESS, SCSS
9 9/19/2023 SCSS, LESS, Bootstrap
10 9/21/2023 Markdown, XML, JSON
Server-Side Processing
11 9/26/2023 Server-side processing a history (CGI, Perl, PHP, Ruby, Python)
12 9/28/2023 Introduction to PHP
10/3/2023 Fall Reading Days
13 10/5/2023 PHP arrays, forms, Regular expressions
14 10/10/2023 Data processing files (CSV, JSON, XML), APIs
15 10/12/2023 Object-oriented PHP, Front Controller Design, Maintaining state
16 10/17/2023 Maintaining state, Databases
17 10/19/2023 Databases, Frameworks
Client-Side Processing
18 10/24/2023 Client-side scripting Introduction to JavaScript
19 10/26/2023 JavaScript arrays, functions, objects
20 10/31/2023 JavaScript DOM, events, forms
21 11/2/2023 JavaScript DOM, events, local storage
11/7/2023 Election Day
22 11/9/2023 AJAX calls with PHP and JSON, JQuery
Client-side Frameworks
23 11/14/2023 JQuery, TypeScript, Intro to frameworks
24 11/16/2023 Introduction to Angular
25 11/21/2023 Angular Forms, Data binding
11/23/2023 Thanksgiving
26 11/28/2023 Angular HttpClient, Services
27 11/30/2023 Project Presentations / Showcase
28 12/5/2023 What does the future of the web look like?
12/14/2023 Final Exam (9am-12pm)
